title: Ticket #7449: Improve token revocation/blacklisting capabilities
description:
There are two mechanisms currently for removing authorization from tokens: you can remove the signing key (which invalidates all tokens signed with that key) or set DENY_* to remove authorization from the mapped identity.

Neither are particularly great. For example, suppose I issue a token for all users at my site in order to enable remote submission. What should I do if a user contacts me saying they lost their token?

  • If all user tokens were signed with the same password, I can remove that password and disable all remote submits to my site.
  • I can permanently disable access to HTCondor for that user by adjusting the configuration.

Given each token looks a bit like a ClassAd - and we have a rich expression language for matching ClassAds, I propose:

  • Allow the admin to set an configuration parameter, TOKEN_BLACKLIST.
  • Once authenticated, the token is converted to a ClassAd.
  • The TOKEN_BLACKLIST is converted to a ClassAd expression and evaluated in the context of the "token ad". Any token matching this blacklist will be rejected.
